title: In Frames: The vanishing practice of Apatanis
description: The Apatani women of Ziro Valley in Arunachal Pradesh are known for their facial tattoos and wooden nose plugs; banned in the 1970s, the tradition now survives only among older women

Sabalenka's victory marks her fourth Grand Slam title and a redemption after previous final losses. She celebrated with champagne, showcasing a relaxed champion who learned from past setbacks, while Anisimova acknowledged not fighting hard enough.

description: Sanjay Bangar shared a story. Shubman Gill's initial net practice amazed everyone. Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, and Ravi Shastri were present. Gill's batting impressed Kohli. Kohli felt he lacked Gill's talent at 19. Shastri wanted Gill in the playing eleven immediately. Gill's talent was evident from the start. Everyone realized his special ability during that session.

He will be watching from Rolex's suite, despite his administration's recent imposition of a 39% tariff on Swiss products. This visit adds to Trump's recent attendance at major sporting events, though ABC's broadcast may avoid showing any potential protests.

description: Following the defacement of the national emblem at Srinagar's Hazratbal shrine, Ladakh LG Kavinder Gupta pledged strict action. Omar Abdullah criticized the emblem's placement, emphasizing its use in government functions, not religious sites. The NC demanded the removal of Waqf Board chairperson Darakhshan Andrabi, alleging misconduct and accusing her of instigating the crisis for political gain, while BJP defended Andrabi.

description: Aryna Sabalenka has not missed a hardcourt major final since 2022 and her latest trophy brings her Grand Slam haul to four, as she became the first woman to win back-to-back U.S

title: FATF lauds work of MHA's portal for international cooperation
description: The FATF report commends India's online MLA portal for streamlining international cooperation in money laundering cases. An ED investigation, in collaboration with the US DOJ, dismantled a darknet-based Fentanyl syndicate, seizing significant Bitcoin assets. This joint effort highlights effective cross-border coordination and India's enhanced capacity for international legal assistance.

title: A private broom: Chennai’s conservancy woes
description: For a few weeks now, conservancy workers in Chennai, who had to shift to private operators, have protested against the loss of income and chances of a permanent job. While this issue has sparked a critique of public-private partnership for core civic tasks, the problems of the workers remain unresolved, write Aloysius Xavier Lopez and R. Aishwaryaa

title: US Open: Sabalenka breaks ‘unpredictable’ tag; turns lessons into legacy
description: Aryna Sabalenka defended her US Open crown in style, beating Amanda Anisimova 6-3, 7-6(3) for her fourth Grand Slam title and 100th major match win. The world No. 1 celebrated in a shimmering silver jacket that matched her trophy, blending grit with glamour on a rain-soaked New York night to become the first repeat champion since Serena Williams.

Mercury levels in Delhi's air highest among 3 Indian cities studied, human activities blamed
description: A recent study by IITM reveals Delhi's air contains the highest mercury concentration among Indian cities, significantly exceeding global background levels. The study, spanning from 2018 to 2024, links the pollution to coal use, traffic, and industries. While Delhi's mercury levels are alarming, the research indicates a decline compared to previous years.

title: PM Modi dinner with NDA MPs called off amid floods across states
description: In light of the widespread devastation caused by severe floods in Punjab and other regions of India, BJP President JP Nadda's dinner for NDA MPs on Saturday and Prime Minister Modi's dinner on Sunday, scheduled before the Vice Presidential elections, have been cancelled. PM Modi is expected to visit the flood-affected areas.

Modi has good personal equation with Trump: EAM amid strained ties with US
description: Following positive remarks from Donald Trump, PM Modi reciprocated, hinting at a potential turnaround in the strained India-US relationship. External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to the partnership, raising prospects of a phone call between the leaders.

title: French president Macron briefs PM Modi on efforts to end Ukraine war
description: PM Modi and President Macron discussed the Ukraine conflict, with Macron briefing Modi on the Coalition of the Willing's meeting in Paris regarding security guarantees for Ukraine. Modi reiterated India's support for peaceful resolution and both leaders affirmed their commitment to strengthening the India-France Strategic Partnership across various sectors.

title: Pan-India SIR exercise will be spread over a month
description: The Election Commission of India is set to conduct a nationwide Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, mirroring the exercise recently held in Bihar. Scheduled to begin soon, this initiative aims to purify the rolls by removing ineligible voters and ensuring all eligible citizens are included.

title: 790-page chargesheet filed in honeymoon murder case
description: Meghalaya police filed a chargesheet against Sonam Raghuvanshi, her lover, and three others for allegedly murdering her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, during their honeymoon in Cherrapunji. The accused face charges of murder, evidence disappearance, and criminal conspiracy. A supplementary chargesheet is expected for three others accused of concealing evidence, who are currently on bail.

title: Movement curbs in Manipur stay despite open national highway
description: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Pro-Khalistan outfits getting funds from Canada, its govt says
description: A Canadian government report reveals that pro-Khalistan terror groups like Babbar Khalsa International and International Sikh Youth Federation receive financial support within Canada. These groups, advocating for an independent state in Punjab through violent means, utilize various funding methods, including diaspora donations and abuse of financial sectors.

title: Boko Haram militants kill 60 in attack in Nigeria's northeast
description: The Bama local government area was the target of several Boko Haram attacks a decade ago, forcing many residents to flee

title: Rila Monastery, a symbol of resilience of the human spirit

title: Will ensure your fiscal health is safeguarded: FM to states
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has reassured states about the Centre's commitment to their fiscal health, addressing concerns over potential revenue impacts from GST rate reductions. The recent GST council meeting rationalized rates, lowering levies on numerous items while adjusting slabs, aiming for an optimal balance between tax incidence and revenue generation.

title: VinFast enters India with two electric SUVs
description: VinFast, the Vietnamese electric carmaker, has entered the Indian market with the launch of two electric SUVs, the VF6 and VF7. Priced starting at Rs 16.5 lakh and Rs 20.9 lakh respectively, these vehicles boast impressive ranges.

title: Chiefs’ Xavier Worthy injury: Fans panic; experts weigh in — latest update
description: Kansas City Chiefs fans are anxious following reports of a potential shoulder dislocation for Xavier Worthy. A sports medicine specialist suggests a possible three-week recovery, but cautions about a high re-injury risk. Surgery, the worst-case scenario, could sideline Worthy for the season. His absence would force offensive adjustments, potentially impacting Mahomes and other receivers.

title: GST cuts: Car, bike, FMCG and online platforms reduce prices
description: Following GST cuts by the government, companies across various sectors, including automotive, e-commerce, and FMCG, have begun reducing prices to pass on the benefits to consumers. Car manufacturers like Mahindra & Mahindra, Tata Motors, and Renault have announced price reductions on their models.

title: Mumbai bids grand farewell to ‘Ganpati Bappa’ amid rains, bomb threat; over 18,000 idols immersed

title: Ambulance falls into gorge, three killed in Himachal
description: In a tragic incident, an ambulance carrying a patient to Ludhiana crashed into a gorge in Una district, Himachal Pradesh, resulting in the death of three individuals. The accident occurred near Gagret when the driver lost control on a curve near Manghuwal. Two others, including the driver, sustained severe injuries and were rushed to a nearby hospital.

title: ED summons BJP man who alleges in court Rahul is a UK citizen
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated an inquiry into Rahul Gandhi's alleged UK citizenship, based on a petition pending in the Allahabad High Court. The agency has summoned BJP member Vignesh Shishir, the petitioner, seeking details about Gandhi's alleged UK citizenship, associated companies, and foreign accounts.

title: Evander Kane’s fiancée Mara Teigen: Celebrates brother Sam’s 26th birthday — night out
description: Mara Teigen, Evander Kane's fiancée, celebrated her brother Sam's 26th birthday with a lively nightclub outing. She shared heartfelt Instagram stories, calling Sam her "best friend for life," highlighting their close sibling bond. The celebration offered fans a glimpse into Teigen's family-first values, showcasing that beyond her modeling career and relationship, family remains a priority.

description: The government has set retail prices for 42 common drug formulations, including Meropenem & Sulbactam injection and Mycophenolate Mofetil tablets. The National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) has mandated manufacturers to issue price lists to dealers and state drug controllers.

title: Watch: Virender Sehwag opens up ahead of Asia Cup – 'Losing to Pakistan...'
description: Virender Sehwag revealed the emotional toll of India's losses to Pakistan, admitting they sometimes disrupted his focus. Despite averaging 50.65 against them, the frequent defeats affected him deeply. He fondly recalled his masterful 119 against Pakistan in 2008 while fasting, showcasing his determination. India is set to face Pakistan in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025.

US tariffs: Trump signs order granting exemptions; zero duties begin Monday for 'aligned partners'
description: President Trump signed an executive order granting tariff exemptions to trading partners who reach agreements on industrial exports, including metals, pharmaceuticals, and chemicals. This move aims to reshape global trade, reduce deficits, and encourage concessions from partner nations. The exemptions, effective Monday, cover goods not sufficiently produced in the U.S. and align with existing agreements, potentially impacting countries like Switzerland.

Intel CEO tightens reins: No big design without his OK; sends message to staff
description: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has initiated a hands-on leadership policy, personally reviewing and approving major chip designs before tape-out. This move aims to enhance execution, reduce costs, and regain competitiveness after a significant financial loss. The policy is part of a broader strategy to streamline operations and strengthen Intel's product roadmap amid pressure from competitors like TSMC.

title: Shilo Sanders NFL update: Waived by Bucs — still unsigned, future uncertain
description: Shilo Sanders, after being released by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers following a preseason ejection for throwing a punch, remains without an NFL team. Despite his agents seeking opportunities, including practice squad positions, no team has claimed him. The Toronto Argonauts hold his CFL rights, and the UFL could be an option next year if an NFL deal doesn't materialize.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
description: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: Meta’s brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg’s own words
description: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.
